NomaiObject: Excavation Site 1 CASSAVA: Concluding findings on experiment regarding effect of water on deadly matter: matter remains in prevalently high and unchanged concentrations, even after prolonged immersion of the island's capsized surface. 2 1 CASSAVA: Disappointingly, water only temporarily displaces the matter, and has no lasting effect on the matter. 3 1 CASSAVA: Although it may not offer a lasting solution to the matter, this discovery, at least, provides a possible answer to the greatest question that has been weighing on my mind. 4 3 CASSAVA: If the deadly matter is unable to penetrate water - unable to harm those underwater, I must infer it was why I alone was spared what happened to our clan, aboard the Deep Storm Station. 5 4 CASSAVA: Extrapolating from this conclusion, this property also explains how several species of the star system's native species dwelling underwater have survived as well. 6 5 CASSAVA: A terrifying realization has just struck me. Oh, I can only offer my immense gratitude for the planet's thick atmosphere obscuring it completely from my sight - or I could have invited them to a similar fate... 7 6 CASSAVA: Of note to self: I must be careful to NEVER lock the Quantum Moon in orbit around Giant's Deep for any extended period, to keep them safe from this terrible danger.
